bag.name: token bag
bag.description: for choosing random tokens at the start of the game

clips.name: clips
clips.description: for attaching the two parts of the box together

rulesheet_characters.name: character sheets
rulesheet_characters.description: each player gets given one of these in the game â€“ so they can reference which characters everyone else could be. adapted from tjhowse's PDFs.

rulesheet_intro.name: quick rules sheets
rulesheet_intro.description: these are to read at the start of the game. there's one written in first person for the storyteller to read, or one in third person for an experienced player to read. the backs are different and show: an overview of setup steps for the storyteller; and the player counts, which can live under the town square, as it should be public. adapted from tjhowse's PDFs.

rulesheet_nightsheet.name: storyteller's nightsheet
rulesheet_nightsheet.description: this is a sheet to remind the storyteller who to wake at nighttime to ask for choices and/or tell information. there are two versions of it, one simple, one complex. I've used paperclips to act as reminders for which characters to wake. adapted from tjhowse's PDFs.

rulesheet_prompts.name: storyteller prompts
rulesheet_prompts.description: these are cards that can be shown at nighttime to make what's happening a bit more obvious

rulesheet_rules.name: rulebooks
rulesheet_rules.description: the main rulebook, and the Trouble Brewing rulebook. These are printed as A6 booklets following these instructions from myself. I've left the split PDFs in case you want to booklet print them without the faff. adapted from tjhowse's PDFs.

rulesheet_taster.name: game summary
rulesheet_taster.description: this is a simple sheet which provides an overview of the game. I thought it would be useful to show people who don't know much about the game :]. adapted from tjhowse's PDFs.

tokenbox.name: token box
tokenbox.description: I had some time while laminating, so I designed a rough-n-ready 3D-printable box which can hold the character tokens perfectly, as well as some misc pots for other tokens. I also laser-cut and laser-engraved some rudimentary lids for the loose sections to stop tokens falling everywhere when I move the box. You'd do just as well with some baggies for the tokens.

tokens_character.name: character tokens
tokens_character.description: the character tokens that everyone draws at random, and that the storyteller uses in the grimoire to reference who the players are. adapted from Aechs' tokens.

tokens_life.name: life tokens
tokens_life.description: the tokens which represent each player on the town square. the front is blank, for 'alive', and the back has a cross, for 'dead'.

tokens_reminder.name: storyteller reminder tokens
tokens_reminder.description: these are for the grimoire, to remind the storyteller who has abilities, who they have/will target, and other miscellany. adapted from Aechs' tokens.

tokens_shrouds.name: character death shrouds
tokens_shrouds.description: shrouds to cover character tokens in the grimoire, reminding the storyteller that they are dead. modelled by lxthrp

tokens_spare.name: spare tokens
tokens_spare.description: just some spare tokens the same size as the life and reminder tokens, in case I lose some, or need to have more players.

tokens_votes.name: final vote tokens
tokens_votes.description: tokens for dead players to act as their final vote. when they die, these are added to their token in the town square, and if they vote while dead, they lose their vote token.

townsquare.name: town square
townsquare.description: decorative piece for the middle of the room, which also holds life tokens and vote tokens, so that everyone in the game can see who is alive and who can vote. I'd also put the player count sheet under this so all the player information is in the same place.
